rooms.description: Spacious entrance area with a small reception desk and display areas.

Open-plan living area incorporating elements of Brutalist design such as exposed concrete, large windows for natural light, and minimalist furniture arrangements. Vastu principles ensure the room is located to maximize sunlight.
Cozy dining area adjacent to the living room, with Vastu-compliant positioning near the entrance for harmonious energy flow.
Dedicated home office designed with an ergonomic layout, ample natural light and quiet ambiance. Placed in a corner adhering to Vastu for concentration and productivity.
Modern kitchen with minimalist Brutalist elements, efficient space planning for joint family cooking needs. Incorporates local building norms with safety and ventilation considerations.
A compact bathroom designed for efficient use in a joint family context, ensuring privacy and ease of access. Vastu principles consider water placement for positive energy.
Storage and utility area for household supplies and appliances, ensuring easy accessibility while maintaining the Brutalist aesthetic with raw finishes.

openings.description: Main entrance door designed to be secure yet inviting, following local building codes and Vastu guidelines for energy flow.
Large windows strategically placed in living room and home office areas to maximize natural light and ventilation, adhering to both aesthetic and local norms.
Balcony access door leading to an outdoor space for relaxation. The balcony is designed in line with Vastu principles for tranquility and natural surroundings.

features.description: A compact swimming pool integrated into the design on the ground floor, offering a recreational space for the joint family while balancing budget constraints.
Small parking lot area designed to accommodate vehicles within local building norms, ensuring functionality without compromising design aesthetics.

rooms.description: Spacious master bedroom incorporating a private balcony facing the east for Vastu compliance and enhanced natural light.
Three additional bedrooms designed for joint family members. Each room is thoughtfully arranged to provide comfort while reflecting the Brutalist design with raw concrete finishes.
Additional bathroom facilities on the first floor for family convenience and privacy.
Ample storage solutions integrated into the design to accommodate joint family needs while adhering to local building norms and Vastu principles.

openings.description: A centrally located staircase connecting the ground and first floor, designed with safety features and minimalistic Brutalist styling.
Balcony windows integrated into bedrooms for ventilation and natural light, aligning with both architectural style and Vastu guidelines.
